decision_conditions: The submitted information is not sufficient to discharge Condition 8 (Landscaping Scheme). Therefore the proposal would fail to demonstrate adequate visual amenity, contrary to Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The submitted information is not sufficient to discharge Condition 3 (Details of Materials). Therefore the proposal would fail to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The information submitted in relation to Condition 5 (Waste and Recycling Facilities) is considered to be insufficient to ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in conflict with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The information submitted in relation to Condition 6 (Cycle Parking) is considered to be insufficient to ensure adequate cycle parking facilities, contrary to policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Details required for Conditions 3 (Facing Materials), 4 (Construction Management Plan), 5 (Waste and Recycling Facilities), 6 (Cycle Parking), 8 (Landscaping Scheme) and 12 (Enclosures) of planning permission 23/00180/FUL (Erection of new dwelling attached to No 12 Sycamore Grove (following demolition of detached garage), relocation of front door to No 12 from side elevation to front elevation, conversion of garage to No 14 to habitable room and erection of single storey rear extension (following demolition of rear storage extension))
